thread.title: Royals tab Volquez to pitch ALCS opener
thread.title_full: Royals tab Volquez to pitch ALCS opener

title: Royals tab Volquez to pitch ALCS opener
text:
Royals tab Volquez to pitch ALCS opener 
The Sports Xchange Thursday, October 15, 2015 03:43 PM EDT | Updated: Thursday, October 15, 2015 03:52 PM EDT Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Edinson Volquez throws against the Houston Astros in game three of the ALDS at Minute Maid Park. (Thomas B. Shea/USA TODAY Sports) Blue Jays vs. Royals: 15 things to know 
The Kansas City Royals have selected Edinson Volquez to be the Game 1 starter when they host the Toronto Blue Jays in the opener of the American League Championship Series on Friday. 
The right-hander went 13-9 with a 3.55 ERA in the regular season. Volquez lost his lone start in the AL Division Series against Houston when he gave up three runs in 5 2/3 innings while matched up against Astros ace Dallas Keuchel. Ned Yost announces Edinson Volquez will pitch #ALCS Game 1, Yordano Ventura set for Game 2 & Johnny Cueto will go in Game 3. #TakeTheCrown — Royals (@Royals) October 15, 2015 
The Blue Jays are expected to choose either left-hander David Price or right-hander Marco Estrada as their Game 1 starter. 
Toronto and Kansas City had a benches-clearing brawl on Aug. 2 in a contest in which Volquez was one of the central figures. He hit Toronto star Josh Donaldson with a pitch in the first inning and threw another pitch high and tight in the third. — Toronto Blue Jays (@BlueJays) October 15, 2015 Sponsored Links
